t: John 13

Now*p before the feast of the passover, when Jesus knew that his hour was come that he should depart out of this world unto the Father, having loved his own which were in the world, he loved them unto the end.
And*p supper being ended, the devil having now put into the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon's son, to betray him;
Jesus*p knowing that the Father had given all things into his hands, and that he was come from God, and went to God;
He*p riseth from supper, and laid aside his garments; and took a towel, and girded himself.
After*p that he poureth water into a basin, and began to wash the disciples' feet, and to wipe them with the towel wherewith he was girded.
Then*p cometh he to Simon Peter: and Peter saith unto him, Lord, dost thou wash my feet?
Jesus*p answered and said unto him, What*r I*r do*r thou*r knowest*r not*r now;*r but*r thou*r shalt*r know*r hereafter.*r
Peter*p saith unto him, Thou shalt never wash my feet. Jesus answered him, If*r I*r wash*r thee*r not,*r thou*r hast*r no*r part*r with*r me.*r
Simon*p Peter saith unto him, Lord, not my feet only, but also my hands and my head.
Jesus*p saith to him, He*r that*r is*r washed*r needeth*r not*r save*r to*r wash*r his*r feet,*r but*r is*r clean*r every*r whit:*r and*r ye*r are*r clean,*r but*r not*r all.*r
For*p he knew who should betray him; therefore said he, Ye*r are*r not*r all*r clean.*r
So*p after he had washed their feet, and had taken his garments, and was set down again, he said unto them, Know*r ye*r what*r I*r have*r done*r to*r you?*r
Ye*rp call*r me*r Master*r and*r Lord:*r and*r ye*r say*r well;*r for*r so*r I*r am.*r
If*rp I*r then,*r your*r Lord*r and*r Master,*r have*r washed*r your*r feet;*r ye*r also*r ought*r to*r wash*r one*r another's*r feet.*r
For*rp I*r have*r given*r you*r an*r example,*r that*r ye*r should*r do*r as*r I*r have*r done*r to*r you.*r
Verily,*rp verily,*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r The*r servant*r is*r not*r greater*r than*r his*r lord;*r neither*r he*r that*r is*r sent*r greater*r than*r he*r that*r sent*r him.*r
If*rp ye*r know*r these*r things,*r happy*r are*r ye*r if*r ye*r do*r them.*r

I*rp speak*r not*r of*r you*r all:*r I*r know*r whom*r I*r have*r chosen:*r but*r that*r the*r scripture*r may*r be*r fulfilled,*r He*r that*r eateth*r bread*r with*r me*r hath*r lifted*r up*r his*r heel*r against*r me.*r
Now*rp I*r tell*r you*r before*r it*r come,*r that,*r when*r it*r is*r come*r to*r pass,*r ye*r may*r believe*r that*r I*r am*r he.*r
Verily,*rp verily,*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r He*r that*r receiveth*r whomsoever*r I*r send*r receiveth*r me;*r and*r he*r that*r receiveth*r me*r receiveth*r him*r that*r sent*r me.*r
When*p Jesus had thus said, he was troubled in spirit, and testified, and said, Verily,*r verily,*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r that*r one*r of*r you*r shall*r betray*r me.*r
Then*p the disciples looked one on another, doubting of whom he spake.
Now*p there was leaning on Jesus' bosom one of his disciples, whom Jesus loved.
Simon*p Peter therefore beckoned to him, that he should ask who it should be of whom he spake.
He*p then lying on Jesus' breast saith unto him, Lord, who is it?
Jesus*p answered, He*r it*r is,*r to*r whom*r I*r shall*r give*r a*r sop,*r when*r I*r have*r dipped*r it.*r And when he had dipped the sop, he gave it to Judas Iscariot, the son of Simon.
And*p after the sop Satan entered into him. Then said Jesus unto him, That*r thou*r doest,*r do*r quickly.*r
Now*p no man at the table knew for what intent he spake this unto him.
For*p some of them thought, because Judas had the bag, that Jesus had said unto him, Buy those things that we have need of against the feast; or, that he should give something to the poor.
He*p then having received the sop went immediately out: and it was night.
Therefore,*p when he was gone out, Jesus said, Now*r is*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r glorified,*r and*r God*r is*r glorified*r in*r him.*r
If*rp God*r be*r glorified*r in*r him,*r God*r shall*r also*r glorify*r him*r in*r himself,*r and*r shall*r straightway*r glorify*r him.*r

Little*rp children,*r yet*r a*r little*r while*r I*r am*r with*r you.*r Ye*r shall*r seek*r me:*r and*r as*r I*r said*r unto*r the*r Jews,*r Whither*r I*r go,*r ye*r cannot*r come;*r so*r now*r I*r say*r to*r you.*r
A*rp new*r commandment*r I*r give*r unto*r you,*r That*r ye*r love*r one*r another;*r as*r I*r have*r loved*r you,*r that*r ye*r also*r love*r one*r another.*r
By*rp this*r shall*r all*r men*r know*r that*r ye*r are*r my*r disciples,*r if*r ye*r have*r love*r one*r to*r another.*r
Simon*p Peter said unto him, Lord, whither goest thou? Jesus answered him, Whither*r I*r go,*r thou*r canst*r not*r follow*r me*r now;*r but*r thou*r shalt*r follow*r me*r afterwards.*r
Peter*p said unto him, Lord, why cannot I follow thee now? I will lay down my life for thy sake.

Jesus*p answered him, Wilt*r thou*r lay*r down*r thy*r life*r for*r my*r sake?*r Verily,*r verily,*r I*r say*r unto*r thee,*r The*r cock*r shall*r not*r crow,*r till*r thou*r hast*r denied*r me*r thrice.*r
